text:
Hi,
I want to display blogs that are related to users. e,g: if user subscribes to blogs about Cars: BMW, next time when user access my website I want to display BMW related posts. Meaning I want to track user's behavior on my site and show related posts based on her/his behavior.

I thought of Smart Content and setting smart rule, but I got stuck: I wanted to check if the rule is true or false. Something like:
`if(smart rule ){`
`	display user-related posts`
`}esle{`
`	display popular posts`
`}`

Hi, i would like to present the HubSpot  CMS to a client but i struggle to find the concrete differences between what is there with Landingpages and all vs. the CMS addon. For me it feels like there is a fuzzy line between those tools. I have not found a resource comparing those two which is not ideal for selling the CMS Addon to clients, have i overlooked something?
After all, there are clients out there that have created 300 Landingpages with each other in order to avoid paying for the Website package...
HubDB is one feature in CMS
yes that is also something that i point out but is that the only difference?
anyone know why the HubSpot/Vidyard Free Integration would render out like this? this is just using the normal embed in a rich text
is the blog only part of the CMS?
hmm..not sure maybe
Looks like something is setting the height via CSS
Does anybody have any links to a tool to convert an Excel spreadsheet/CSV of blogs to Wordpress XML format so we can import them into a HubSpot blog?
import csv into a local wordpress install, export to xml /shrug
I stumbled upon this earlier today <https://github.com/williamspiro/hubXml>
You can access Blog and Landing Pages as part of the Marketing Professional package as well.
we aren’t setting anything. we are just letting the HubSpot/vidyard embed handle everything

Is anyone experiencing this BUG with Simple Menus???

I have a simple menu linked to an active content page ( ie. .com/support )

However, when the menu renders on the front-end the link turns to ( .com/support-archived-0 )

The page isn’t archived and I have no idea why it would be doing this.  I’ve had to set up URL redirects to get around the issue.

Yet another question for you all :grimacing:

What’s the current best practice for creating new site projects?
Both Crankshift and the official boilerplate have warnings against using this for prod builds as their in early development stages.
personalty … coded templates and custom modules
working like this for the past 4+ years
header, footer, flexible column in the middle and then just custom modules
like in the matrix “there is no template” :wink:
ahh ok cool, good to know
I guess I’m looking for a starting point that already follows best practices, especially because I’m pretty new to the platform
<@U2PDTMH53> when you say “coded templates” do you mean an existing custom template that you build from?
nu
no
Design Manager - New File - Coded Template
i can give you my starting point template file and css
That would be super helpful thank you
Thanks for your help by the way
Hey, I'm speaking with the volunteer group coordinating tech for Elizabeth Warren's campaign. Is there someone who's used HubSpot for political campaigns before?
